message.content:
A 'potter's_wheel' is a mechanical device used to shape clay into pottery. 
It typically consists of a circular platform mounted on bearings, which rotates horizontally. 
The wheel is either powered by electricity or by a pedal-operated mechanism. 
Its color and texture can vary, ranging from smooth and polished to rough and worn-out. 
The shape of the wheel is generally circular, with a height of around 2-3 feet. 
Potter's wheels are commonly found in pottery studios and workshops, where they are used by potters and ceramic artists. 
They have been used for centuries, dating back to ancient times, to create various forms of pottery.
